tweet: Generic prescription drugs cost on average 80% less than their name brand alternatives. That savings is important to Arizona families. Today @HouseJudiciary advanced 4 bipartisan bills to hold big drug companies accountable and make sure generic options are more widely available.

Discrimination on the basis of sex is still legal by our own Constitution. But the Equal Rights Amendment would change that. Today, @HouseJudiciary held the first hearing on the ERA in 36 years—an important step toward legal gender equality. #ERANow

Reauthorizing and expanding the Violence Against Women Act is vital, especially to Arizonans. Our state has zero funding for sexual violence services, which means shelters and crisis centers rely on #VAWA to help victims. I'm proud to cosponsor #VAWA19 and see it pass the House.
A video from the Governor’s @AzMxCom sums it up: "The port of entry has become the catalyst for economic development and opportunities here at the border." Watch here: https://youtu.be/etgUIfQj4-I
The automotive industry in Arizona and Sonora produces 1,488 vehicles daily, supporting more than 50,600 employees.
Together, Arizona and Mexico are leaders in the automotive industry, importing $968 million and $761 million in auto parts in 2016 – net trade of nearly $1.7 billion annually.

Arizona’s expanded ports of entry are driving investment in infrastructure. Nearly $60 million of private investment has resulted from improvements to border infrastructure in Nogales for warehouses and distribution centers to support international commerce.

Nearly 3.8 million people from Mexico choose Arizona as a travel destination annually, which represents the largest segment of international tourism to our state. Visitors from Mexico contribute between 60%-70% of sales tax revenue in our border communities.

Arizona’s infrastructure supports international trade and tourism with six international border ports of entry, including one of the nation’s largest commercial ports, the Mariposa Port of Entry in Nogales.
Arizona’s two-way trade with Mexico was $15.4 billion in 2017: nearly $7.5 billion in exports and $7.9 billion in imports.
Since 2012, we've worked hard to repair Arizona's once badly damaged relationship with our largest trading partner. Here are some facts from the Governor’s @AzMxCom, for those who need a refresher:

It seems some in Washington and Arizona have forgotten how important trade with Mexico is to our state’s economy. That’s troubling. A border shutdown today—or in the future—would be devastating for Arizona.

Today I joined my colleagues in introducing the #ColoradoRiver Drought Contingency Plan Authorization Act to take the next key step in planning for Arizona's water future. To prepare for the impact of climate change and drought in the West, we must pass the Act without delay.
Tomorrow, our @HouseJudiciary Committee will hold the first ever hearing on the #EqualityAct. It's time to finally provide LGBT individuals full protection under the law.
